Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[SAS Token] Fallback when permissions cannot be use on container creation." (#8315) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
In some places we create a container and right after we set the permissions access, since we cannot modify permissions after a container has been created when using a sas token we need to modify this behavior to add the permissions at creation time.

**AuthorizationFailure** is the error we get when trying to perform an update of the permissions of an already created container.
See error on: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/sas-error-codes

Address: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3484

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add netstandard2.1 support to NuGetGallery.Core and NuGet.Services.Entities" (#8320) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is required because these two libraries are transitive dependencies of NuGet.Services.AzureSearch. It would be technically possible to run the Azure Search Service without this change, but it would require a significantly more complex changeset in NuGet.Jobs to split all of the projects and files depended on by the search service into two halves: "required by Azure Search Service" and "not required by Azure Search Service". For example, there is a shared DI wire-up step for all search components which would need to be cleverly split. See [DependencyInjectionExtensions.cs](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/bbd7a3c6ebf87e1f4c7b2e6e34e3607c5ce242da/src/NuGet.Services.AzureSearch/DependencyInjectionExtensions.cs#L25).

The simpler approach is to make all project dependencies of the search service compatible with a `netcoreapp3.1` (and eventually `net5.0`) entry point. In this cases, it's a `netstandard2.1` cross-target. We need `netstandard2.1` instead of the ServerCommon `netstandard2.0` since Entity Framework supports `netstandard2.1`. Since ServerCommon already has the required .NET Core support, these are the only projects that remain outside of NuGet.Jobs to have .NET Core support.

Changes:
- Move NuGetGallery.Core and NuGet.Services.Entities to SDK-based projects
- Introduce a shared props file for these two projects. We can't use Build.Directory.props since not all projects are converted.
- Add a `netstandard2.1` target to these two projects.
- Update ServerCommon version
- Conditionally compile a select few lines of code that are not required for the Azure Search Service.
- Note that this brings Markdig up to version 0.22.0 (/cc @lyndaidaii)

Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3487.

Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
